ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: How frequently did you hear about or see other people of the same racial group experiencing racism... In public?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= About once a month; 2= A few times a month; 3= Once a week; 4= A few times a week; 5= Every day

ElementDescription: How frequently did you hear about or see other people of the same racial group experiencing racism... In the news?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= About once a month; 2= A few times a month; 3= Once a week; 4= A few times a week; 5= Every day

ElementDescription: How frequently did you hear about experiences of racism of... Current or past romantic partners?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= About once a month; 2= A few times a month; 3= Once a week; 4= A few times a week; 5= Every day

ElementDescription: How frequently did you hear about experiences of racism of... Friends and family members?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= About once a month; 2= A few times a month; 3= Once a week; 4= A few times a week; 5= Every day

ElementDescription: How frequently did you hear racist things said by... Politicians?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= About once a month; 2= A few times a month; 3= Once a week; 4= A few times a week; 5= Every day

ElementDescription: How frequently did you hear racist things said by... Other public figures?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= About once a month; 2= A few times a month; 3= Once a week; 4= A few times a week; 5= Every day

ElementDescription: How frequently did you see racist posts on social media during the COVID-19 pandemic?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= About once a month; 2= A few times a month; 3= Once a week; 4= A few times a week; 5= Every day

ElementDescription: Mean Frequency Score
Notes: Average of all vicarious racism frequency questions (vicarious_racism_public, vicarious_racism_news, vicarious_racism_partner, vicarious_racism_family, vicarious_racism_politician, vicarious_racism_figure, vicarious_racism_media)

ElementDescription: How much did you think about these vicarious racism experiences?
Notes: 0= Never; 4= Always

ElementDescription: How distressed were you about these vicarious racism experiences?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 4= Extremely

ElementDescription: How concerned were you about these vicarious racism experiences?
Notes: 0= Not at all; 4= Extremely

ElementDescription: Impact Weight Variable
Notes: Average of impact questions (vicarious_racism_think,  vicarious_racism_distress, vicarious_racism_concern) / 4

ElementDescription: Overall Vicarious Racism Score
Notes: Impact Weight Variable * Frequency Score (vicarious_racism_impact * vicarious_racism_freq_avg)

ElementDescription: How much did you experience vicarious racism during the COVID-19 pandemic?
Notes: 1= More than usual; 2= Less than usual; 3= About the same

ElementDescription: How much changed in your own experiences of discrimination or being treated unfairly because of your race?
Notes: 1= More than usual; 2= Less than usual; 3= About the same

ElementDescription: How often did you avoid going to places because of the possibility of being discriminated against because of race?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= About once a month; 2= A few times a month; 3= Once a week; 4= A few times a week; 5= Every day

ElementDescription: How often were you feeling on guard because of the possibility of being discriminated against because of race?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= About once a month; 2= A few times a month; 3= Once a week; 4= A few times a week; 5= Every day

ElementDescription: How often were you being vigilant because of the possibility of being discriminated against because of race?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= About once a month; 2= A few times a month; 3= Once a week; 4= A few times a week; 5= Every day

ElementDescription: How often were you being fearful during the COVID-19 or coronavirus pandemic because of the possibility of being discriminated against because of race?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= About once a month; 2= A few times a month; 3= Once a week; 4= A few times a week; 5= Every day

ElementDescription: Mean Racial Discrimination-Related Vigilance Score
Notes: Average of all racial discrimination-related vigilance (racism_vigilance_avoid, racism_vigilance_guard, racism_vigilance_vigilant, racism_vigilance_fear)

ElementDescription: In the past 30 days, how often did you do the following things: I avoid going to some places where I think I will be discriminated against because of my race.
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Once; 2=A few times; 3=Once a week; 4=A few times a week; 5=Almost every day

ElementDescription: In the past 30 days, how often did you do the following things: I feel that I have to be on guard in some situations because I anticipate that I will be discriminated against because of my race.
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Once; 2=A few times; 3=Once a week; 4=A few times a week; 5=Almost every day

ElementDescription: In the past 30 days, how often did you do the following things: I feel like I have to be vigilant about the possibility I will be discriminated against because of my race.
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Once; 2=A few times; 3=Once a week; 4=A few times a week; 5=Almost every day

ElementDescription: In the past 30 days, how often did you do the following things: I fear that I will be discriminated against because of my race.
Notes: 0=Never; 1=Once; 2=A few times; 3=Once a week; 4=A few times a week; 5=Almost every day

ElementDescription: How often do your parents talk to you about how prejudice, discrimination, and racism might make others feel?
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Fairly often; 5 = Very often

ElementDescription: How often do your parents talk to you to explain why prejudice, discrimination, and racism happen?
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Fairly often; 5 = Very often

ElementDescription: How often do your parents talk to you about their own experiences of prejudice, discrimination, and racism?
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Fairly often; 5 = Very often

ElementDescription: How often do your parents talk to you about how their experiences of prejudice, discrimination, and racism make them feel?
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Fairly often; 5 = Very often

ElementDescription: How often do your parents talk to you to explain why prejudice, discrimination, and racism happen to them?
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Fairly often; 5 = Very often

ElementDescription: How often do you talk to your parents about prejudice, discrimination, and racism?
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Fairly often; 5 = Very often

ElementDescription: How often do you talk to your parents about how experiences of prejudice, discrimination, and racism might make others feel?
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Fairly often; 5 = Very often

ElementDescription: How often do you talk to your parents about why prejudice, discrimination, and racism happen?
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Fairly often; 5 = Very often

ElementDescription: How often do you talk to your parents about your own experiences of prejudice, discrimination, and racism?
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Fairly often; 5 = Very often

ElementDescription: How often do you talk to your parents about how your own experiences of prejudice, discrimination, and racism make you feel?
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Fairly often; 5 = Very often

ElementDescription: How often do you talk to your parents to find out why prejudice, discrimination, and racism happens to you?
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Fairly often; 5 = Very often

ElementDescription: How often do your parents talk to you about prejudice, discrimination, and racism?
Notes: 1 = Never; 2 = Almost never; 3 = Sometimes; 4 = Fairly often; 5 = Very often

ElementDescription: How often have you heard or seen racist posts on social media (TikTok, Instagram, Twitter/X, etc.)?
Notes: 0= Never; 1= About once a month; 2= A few times a month; 3= Once a week; 4= A few times a week; 5= Every day
